result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew Lloyd Schroeder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to another county or state.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by PO. 

DNA sample.

Case called: 8:23am
State appears by ADA C.Minder. Defendant appears in person/ and with Atty Amanda Ley.


COURT questions State re: need for Albanian interpreter for witnesses; State advises that interpreter will be needed only for witness testimony and not entire trial.
COURT notes Clerk of Courts office notes interpreter for witnesses can appear by phone but are not likely in person -- Parties make statements on issue of in person versus phone interpreter.
COURT will direct COC to prepare for Albanian interpreter to be available by phone for the first day of trial in either late morning or early afternoon.

Atty Ley makes statement regarding redacted information from discovery -- requests COURT review that discovery In Camera; State does not object and COURT will provide those documents before the end of this week, and COURT will make ruling by Monday 1/30/17.

State files JI - Atty Ley to comment on State's JI and provide to State and COURT by Monday 1/30.
Verdict form will be standard per COURT unless parties file any information otherwise.

JT date remains on court's calendar
